did.unittitle: Association of Presbyterian Church Educators records

bioghist.p: The Association of Presbyterian Church Educators is a professional association concerned with the advancement of education in the church. Its predecessor was the Association of Christian Educators.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Association of Presbyterian Church Educators. Materials include: meeting minutes, 1995-2006; videotapes, audiotapes, and CDs of meetings and annual events and a promotional videotape; copies of newsletters; copies of the APCE's constitution and by-laws; correspondence files, including correspondence related to annual meetings, the "APCE Advocate," the Val Murphy Scholarship, and certification and ordination of church educators, 1970-2004; scrapbooks, 1971-2000; photographs, circa 1956-1998; records on the history of APCE; workshop files; and a publication containing biographical sketches and photographs of the APCE educators of the year for 1978-2000. The collection also includes records of the Association of United Presbyterian Christian Educators (TAUPCE), 1957-1970, and of the Association of Christian Educators (PCUS), 1954.
